data.title: Thomas Digby Pigott (1840-1927)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Thomas Pigott born 1840 High Downs, Buckinghamshire,  England, United Kingdom died 1927 Erpingham, Norfolk, England, United Kingdom including ancestors + descendants + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Sir Thomas Digby Pigott

Born 5 Mar 1840 in High Downs, Buckinghamshire, England, United Kingdom

Ancestors

Son of John Robert Pigott and Emma Upcher

Husband of Julia Macdonald-Moreton — married 27 Apr 1878 in St. George, Hanover Square, London, England, United Kingdom

Descendants

Died 26 Jan 1927 at age 86 in Erpingham, Norfolk, England, United Kingdom

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 21 Feb 2023 | Created 26 Sep 2015

This page has been accessed 770 times.

Biography

Thomas was born in 1840. He was the son of John Pigott and Emma Upcher. [1]

His family are listed in the census 1901. [2]

He passed away in 1927.

Sources

Birth GRO 1st quarter 1840 at Wycombe 6. 452

Marriage GRO 2nd quarter 1878 at St. George Hanover Square 1a. 706

Death GRO 1st quarter 1927 at Erpingham 4b. 105

Burial at All Saints church, upper Sheringham, Norfolk

UK Census 1841 at Vicarage Hughendon, Buckinghamshire with Parents and siblings

UK Census 1851 at Ashwellthorpe, Norfolk Harriett Piggott, age 47, widow, Lady, born Alexron. Leicestershire John Robert Piggott age 60, married, Visitor, born Chelmsford occupation Rector of Ashwellthorpe Digby Piggott, age 5. Visitor, born Higham Down, Buckinghamshire

UK Census 1891 at 5 Onslow Gardens. Kensington Thomas Piggott, age 51, born Haddenham occupation civil Servant, HM Stationery Officer Julia, wife, age 48, born Scotland Mary, daughter, age 9 Emma, daughter, age 8 Harriet, daughter, age 7 Winifred daughter, age 6 Children all born London

UK Census 1901 at 5 Ovington Gardens, Kensington with wife and children Occupation Controller of HM Stationery Office

UK Census 1911 at The lodge, The Boulevard. Sheringham Norfolk with wife and children occupation Retired Civil Servant

↑ "England Births and Christenings, 1538-1975," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.1.1/N5NP-SJC : accessed 28 May 2016), Thomas Digby Pigott, 27 Apr 1840; citing HUGHENDEN,BUCKINGHAM,ENGLAND, reference ; FHL microfilm 919,233.

↑ Thomas D Pigott, Kensington, London, Middlesex, England; from "1901 England, Scotland and Wales census," database and images, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : n.d.); citing Brompton subdistrict, PRO RG 13, The National Archives, Kew, Surrey.
